title: Issues with FPS, Freezing and Audio cutting out
body:
Following the most recent patch and release of Elementalist Lux, I have been experiencing issues with my FPS fluctuating (from 06 to 160) in games. Ping remains relatively stable at around 34. In addition to the FPS, I will occasionally freeze for a few seconds during games. I'm also experiencing audio cutting out around the same time that the game freezes. It then loads back in a few seconds later like nothing happened. Prior to this recent patch, I did not have these sorts of issues. I've been playing this game since Season 3, and for the last two seasons on this laptop and have never had a problem (unless riot servers themselves were experiencing problems). I have attempted repairing the client twice. As for graphics settings, I currently have them set at medium to see if that would help any, but I used to play with high graphics and had no issues whatsoever. 

Specs:
Windows 10 OS.
Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3337U CPU @ 1.80GHz.
64-bit OS with x64-bit processor.
12GB RAM
NVIDIA GEFORCE 740M Graphics card
Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000

If anyone has any informaton that could help me that would be great!! It's really ruining this game for me.

replies.body:
There may be background applications causing your issues, especially since a repair and changing graphics settings didn't cause an immediate change. To check if this is the case, I recommend following [**these steps**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) in order to perform a clean boot on your computer.

Please let me know if this caused any change.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/tGAypEoJ-massive-fps-drops-while-playing-as-well-as-screen-freezing

Clearly i'm not the only one having this issue. I'm thinking it's not my computer (being that I had no issues prior to last patch).

A relatively large batch of Windows 10 updates did go out over the last few days. It's possible one of them re-enabled the *Game DVR* feature inside the Windows Game Bar. This feature had caused freezing and FPS issues in the past, so I'd like you to [**disable the Game Bar entirely**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) in case this issue is popping up again.

I hope this was the culprit!

It seems the Game Bar was the culprit. I successfully played an ARAM with no freezing or audio cuts. My FPS is still a bit lower than normal, but it's stable enough that i can play now so no big deal. Thanks so much!
